dcterms:creator: Zhi-Qin John Xu
Yaoyu Zhang
Tao Luo
Yanyang Xiao
Zheng Ma
dcterms:description: The Poisson problem is a fundamental partial differential equation that describes the relationship between the potential function and its sources. In this study, it is used to illustrate the loss-jump phenomenon when switching loss functions in neural network training.
dcterms:title: Poisson problem

dcterms:creator: Zhi-Qin John Xu
Yaoyu Zhang
Tao Luo
Yanyang Xiao
Zheng Ma
dcterms:description: The Burgers equation is used to study fluid mechanics, turbulence, and shock waves. It serves as a simple model for understanding complex fluid problems and is analyzed in the context of neural network training dynamics.
dcterms:title: Burgers equation

dcterms:creator: Zhi-Qin John Xu
Yaoyu Zhang
Tao Luo
Yanyang Xiao
Zheng Ma
dcterms:description: The heat equation describes heat conduction and diffusion processes. It is analyzed in the context of neural network training to observe the effects of switching loss functions on training dynamics.
dcterms:title: Heat equation

dcterms:creator: Zhi-Qin John Xu
Yaoyu Zhang
Tao Luo
Yanyang Xiao
Zheng Ma
dcterms:description: The diffusion equation is used to model the diffusion process and is analyzed in the context of neural network training dynamics, particularly focusing on the effects of different loss functions.
dcterms:title: Diffusion equation

dcterms:creator: Zhi-Qin John Xu
Yaoyu Zhang
Tao Luo
Yanyang Xiao
Zheng Ma
dcterms:description: The wave equation describes the propagation of waves and is analyzed in the context of neural network training to observe the effects of switching loss functions on training dynamics.
dcterms:title: Wave equation
